apex.label: Apex "Cold War" Era
apex.heading: 1987-1992: The Apex "Cold War"
apex.description: The band's first releases were defined by a "cold war" with their label, Apex Records, who suppressed their rock sound to push a marketable synth-pop image.

freedom.label: The "Freedom" Era
freedom.heading: 1995-2007: The "Freedom" Era
freedom.description: After the contract was voided, the band retreated to "The Fortress"â€”a warehouse studio where they finally forged the industrial-rock sound they always heard in their heads.

reignition.label: The "Re-Ignition" Era
reignition.heading: 2015-2016: Homecoming
reignition.description: Following an eight-year hiatus to focus on family, the band returned with a polished, powerful sound that reconciled their pop history with their rock identity.

modern.label: Modern Era & Soundtracks
modern.heading: 2017-Present: The Transmission
modern.description: The band no longer tours for profit. They operate as a musical collective, releasing atmospheric soundtracks and concept albums broadcast from the Engine Room.
